data.title: Allow pinning debug action pane to debug sidebar
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Anniversary x64

No matter where I move the debug action pane, it always blocks something so that I have to move it again.
Why not pin it to the debug sidebar, just under debug configuration. At least make it a setting so users can turn it on if they don't need floating one.

data.title: TextEditor.revealRange on main window scrolls peek definition window too.
data.body:
It seems to scroll the peek window in the direction of the range. If the range is contained by the range of the peek window, the peek window will not scroll.  

This is an annoying bug in VSCodeVim since we use that function all the time. Makes it impossible to refer to the peek while editing.

data.title: Show Reinstall VSCode Error Message when our Bundled tsserver.js is Missing
data.body: Fixes #21689

data.title: Add Instructions For Missing Bundled TSServer.js File
data.body:
Some antivirus programs (namely 360) are currently deleting the typescript implementation source files from VSCode. This has resulted in a large number of bug reports.

To improve this experience, we should check for the existence of the bundled `tsserver.js` file before attempting to run in. If it does not exist, we should prompt users to reinstall and/or provide to documentation on `typescript.tsdk`setting

data.title: PHP - automatic use statements and better autocompletion required
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.0
- OS Version: Windows 10Pro
- Build: 14393.693

I am really enjoying VS Code while working with JS and Html. Thanks for the wonderful product.  
However, I am bit unhappy when it comes to working with PHP in VS Code. I know that VS Code is not an IDE - its an editor.  
  
This is more like a feature request and I don't think that it would be too hard as similar has already been implemented in Atom and works quite well.  

The PHP intellisense by Felix Becker is a welcome addition, however it is slow. 
Features required/requested:

1. Better Autocompletion with improved speed of indexing - something like Atom's  php-integrator-auto-completion
2. Automatic use statements - Included in Atom's php-integrator-auto-completion  
3. **If possible** Basic refactoring like renaming variables/methods and extract selected code block to a method - again Atom has a package php-integrator-refactoring  
  
Atom's `php-integrator` package suite works quite well and since Atom is also built using electron, I believe it won't be that difficult for VS Code team to provide such features for PHP developers.    

Below are the Atom packages repositories which I have mentioned, if it helps  
https://github.com/php-integrator/core  
https://github.com/php-integrator/atom-autocompletion 
https://github.com/php-integrator/atom-refactoring

data.title: Use Custom "No Definition Found" Message For Go to Implementation and Go to Type Definition
data.body: When executing the `Go To Implementation` command and the `go to type definition` command, we always use `No Definition Found` message These messages should be specific to the command

data.title: Pointer capture when moving sashes or scrollbars

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.10

---

While dragging the sash, the mouse cursor changes when going over different UI elements:

![pointer capture broken](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1730702/23487727/4b0931f0-fee8-11e6-85d0-8b91e269c5fa.gif)

In the above gif, I'm maintaining my mouse button pressed during the entire sash drag, but the cursor change from the vertical double arrow to the pointer and then insert variants. The expected behavior is that the cursor should be captured by the element being dragged and shouldn't change even if it hover different elements.

Since Electron/Chrome doesn't support the [setCapture]() API which would be the canonical solution to this problem, we have to rely on workarounds using JavaScript events and CSS. I changed the implementation when implementing #4702 and at that time it was workingat least on my machine, but the implementation has changed since then. The following blog post describe an approach that seems more robust than what I had implemented: http://code.fitness/post/2016/06/capture-mouse-events.html.

data.title: Word wrap not working for lines above 1000 characters
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new file containing one line that is 1001 characters long. At this point, Alt+Z switches word wrap on and off, as expected. Leave word wrap on.
2. Click on a different tab or press Ctrl+N to switch to editing a different file.
3. Go back to the original file. Word wrap is now disabled and Alt+Z doesn't do anything anymore.
4. Delete exactly one character, so that the line is 1000 characters long.
5. Switch to a different tab and back again. Word wrap is now working fine.

data.title: Can't remove a BP when it's moved past the end of the file
data.body:
See https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-node-debug2/issues/90

If the debug adapter returns a BP at line 11, but the file is only 10 lines long, then it can't be removed by clicking on the BP icon. If you click on that line, it tries to set a new BP on 10, but doesn't remove the one at 11

Ideally the debug adapter wouldn't do that, but in this case, Chrome/Node will actually return the BP being on an invalid line. No clue why. And the debug adapter doesn't know how many lines the file is, so it can't validate/trim it.

data.title: Settings button does not appear immediately after installing an extension
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Extension viewlet
2. Search for an extension from market place which is not installed
3. Install the extension

Expected: Settings button should appear once installed
Observed: Only Reload button is shown.

data.title: Feature request: plugin management in terms of folder

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.0 (February 2017)
- OS Version: 10.12.3

After this update, which just happened, I found more interesting features as well as plugins in vscode. However, it's becoming more and more difficult to manage them.

I'm just wondering, is it possible for you guys to build a management tool using folder/directory. In that way users could do the following things very easily:
- keep track of language support plugins, like what to add/delete, etc
- enable/disable the whole folder to support certain language
- pick one plugin among similar ones, say one theme from others
